sections.instructions:
For best results, sample from areas where plants are or will be growing.
Collect soil samples: Use the custom soil coring tool to collect 3-6 samples from different areas of your garden bed or planting area.
Mix the samples: Mix in your bag or a mixing bowl. Remove rocks and debris, and place a portion of the mixed soil into the sample kraft bag.
Send your sample: Seal the bag, attach the ID sticker, and place it in the box. Use the prepaid shipping label and send it in the mail.
Get your results: After the lab receives your sample, you'll get an email with your detailed soil test and analysis within 3-4 weeks.
sections.faq:
Helpful Tips from Yard Advisors:
What exactly does this soil test measure?
Our comprehensive analysis measures 15 key metrics, including essential nutrients like phosphorus and potassium, pH levels, organic matter, and cation exchange capacity – everything your garden needs for success.
When should I test my garden soil?
Test before planting season or when planning a new garden area. Fall and early spring are ideal times to test, giving you time to amend the soil before peak growing season.
How do I understand my test results?
Your soil test comes with a report-style soil analysis and expert support to help you take action or resolve soil issues in your garden. And when you need it, our Yard Advisor and garden experts are available to help you every step of the way.
Can I use this kit for different garden areas?
Yes! Test vegetable gardens, flower beds, herb gardens, or any growing area. Just note different areas when sampling if you want specific recommendations for each.
How often should I test my soil?
We recommend testing every three years or whenever new garden areas are started. Soil testing over time helps track improvements and helps you adjust nutrients and amendments as needed.
